entry.title: Limit bandwidth
entry.content:
If you are using a data plan that is capped, for example on 3G/4G, applications like Skype can have quite the impact on your usage. In order to contain these applications to a certain bandwidth instead of allowing them to use the entire bandwidth available, it is possible to limit your traffic.

Note: Must be superuser for these commands, or use sudo.

Create a new pipe limiting bandwidth to 100 KB/s {% gist 2602124 1_create_pipe %}

Add the pipe to all ports {% gist 2602124 2_add_pipe_to_all_ports %}

Remove the pipe {% gist 2602124 3_remove_pipe %}

entry.title: Use Apple Gatekeeper with 10.7.3
entry.content:
In order to test your OSX application with the upcoming 10.8 “Mountain Lion” feature Gatekeeper, it can be enabled under 10.7.3.

This can be done with a simple terminal command.
